title: Nội dung

sections.heading: Nội dung
content: DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS

sections.heading: 2. LECTURER’S INFORMATION
content: Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan				Title:  PhD
Address: Room 1312 A1 Building
Phone number: 0913537768					Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn

sections.heading: 3. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
content: The Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining course will provide students with basic knowledge, methods and skills of data analysis using advanced methods of data mining to discover knowledge from large data sets that traditional methods do not perform effectively. In this course, we will use BI tools in the database management system Microsoft SQL Server version 2008 and above and some open source tools to illustrate and simulate the problems that will be presented. The course contents include Basics of knowledge discovery and data mining, Data preprocessing, Association rule mining, Data classification, Cluster analysis, Trends and problems of data mining.

sections.heading: Course Book(s):
content: [1] Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, Jian Pei, Data mining: Concepts and Techniques, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 2012

sections.heading: Reference Book(s):
content: [2] Mohammed J. Zaki, Wagner Meira Jr., Data Mining and Analysis Fundamental Concepts and Algorithms, Cambridge University Press, 2013

sections.heading: Software(s):
content: [3] BI tools in MicroSoft SQL Server (www.microsoft.com)
[4] WEKA (www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/ml/weka)
[5] R programming language (www.r-project.org)

sections.heading: 9.1. Attendance Requirements
content: Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
Students are allowed to be absent maximum 10% of the class hours. Students who is absent over 10% is not qualified to take the final exam.

sections.heading: 9.2. In-class Behavior Requirements
content: The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders are prohibited.
Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
Cellphone, laptop, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for anyother entertainment purposes while in class duration.

full_text:
DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS 
(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)
1. GENERAL INFORMATION
2. LECTURER’S INFORMATION
Full name: Nguyen Trung Tuan				Title:  PhD
Address: Room 1312 A1 Building
Phone number: 0913537768					Email: tuannt@neu.edu.vn
3. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
The Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining course will provide students with basic knowledge, methods and skills of data analysis using advanced methods of data mining to discover knowledge from large data sets that traditional methods do not perform effectively. In this course, we will use BI tools in the database management system Microsoft SQL Server version 2008 and above and some open source tools to illustrate and simulate the problems that will be presented. The course contents include Basics of knowledge discovery and data mining, Data preprocessing, Association rule mining, Data classification, Cluster analysis, Trends and problems of data mining.
4. LEARNING RESOURCES: COURSE BOOKS, REFERENCE BOOKS, AND SOFTWARES
Course Book(s):
[1] Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, Jian Pei, Data mining: Concepts and Techniques, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 2012
Reference Book(s): 
[2] Mohammed J. Zaki, Wagner Meira Jr., Data Mining and Analysis Fundamental Concepts and Algorithms, Cambridge University Press, 2013
Software(s):
[3] BI tools in MicroSoft SQL Server (www.microsoft.com)
[4] WEKA (www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/ml/weka)
[5] R programming language (www.r-project.org)
5. COURSE GOALS
Table 5.1. Course Learning Outcomes
6. COURSE LEARNING OUTCOMES
Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes
7. COURSE ASSESSMENT
Table 7.1. Course assessment
8. LESSON PLAN
Table 8.1. Lesson Plaan
9. COURSE REQUIREMENTS AND EXPECTATION
9.1. Attendance Requirements
Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
Students are allowed to be absent maximum 10% of the class hours. Students who is absent over 10% is not qualified to take the final exam.
9.2. In-class Behavior Requirements
The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders are prohibited.
Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
Cellphone, laptop, tablet are only accepted for the purposes of taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for anyother entertainment purposes while in class duration.
